meanings.definition: The act of applying a layer of mud or cement to the top of a wall or structure to protect it from weathering.
meanings.sent1: The mudcapping on the old house kept the rain from damaging the roof.
meanings.sent2: The builder carefully did the mudcapping to shield the wall from the harsh sun.
meanings.sent3: The mudcapping on the castle made it look like it was wearing a protective hat.
meanings.sent4: The mudcapping was like a shield, guarding the structure from the elements.
meanings.sent5: The mudcapping stood out, a thick layer of defense against nature's forces.

meanings.definition: A protective covering of mud or cement applied to the top of a wall or structure.
meanings.sent1: The mudcapping on the fence kept it strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins still had remnants of mudcapping on their walls.
meanings.sent3: The mudcapping looked like a cozy blanket for the building.
meanings.sent4: The mudcapping was a tough armor, shielding the structure from harm.
meanings.sent5: The mudcapping added a rustic charm to the architecture, blending in seamlessly.

meanings.definition: The process of finishing a construction project by applying a layer of mud or cement to the top.
meanings.sent1: The mudcapping of the tower was the final touch before the project was complete.
meanings.sent2: The workers were proud of their mudcapping skills, ensuring a job well done.
meanings.sent3: The mudcapping process felt like the cherry on top of the construction sundae.
meanings.sent4: The mudcapping was the last stroke of the brush, completing the masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The mudcapping brought the project together, sealing it with a protective layer.
